intro: Sisymbrium capense, commonly known as the Cape crucifer, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has pinnately divided leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, and it produces cylindrical pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
